alert.note: Alert for Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 4:56PM CDT until May 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Gonzales, Guadalupe, Karnes and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 456 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Poth, Stockdale, Kosciusko, Nixon, La Vernia, Falls City, Smiley, New Berlin, Pandora, Gillett, Sutherland Springs, Cestohowa, Cheapside, Leesville, Ecleto, Paweleville, Sample, Wrightsboro, Pana Maria and Hobson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
